isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - PRO SLEEPER ELECTRICAL SYSTEM - HEATER/AIR CONDITIONER DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The heating and/or cooling source for the sleeper unit is the Blendaire heater/air conditioning unit located in the cab.

The cab heater/air conditioning controls are used to select the heating and/or cooling mode (for cab and sleeper) and to select the amount of heating or cooling that is desired for the cab area. Additional controls (1.1 Standard or 1.2 Thermostat) are located in the sleeper unit, to adjust the bunk comfort levels independently from the cab area.

svcproc.title: MANUAL HEATER/A.C. TEMPERATURE CONTROLS
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 1 for the following discussion. There is an air duct connecting the Blendaire unit to the sleeper. A blower motor in the sleeper draws air from the blendaire unit. The sleeper blower also includes a damper door to further control air flow to the sleeper.

Standard sleeper heater/A.C. controls include a three-speed blower switch, manual temperature selector knob and winter/summer switch. The temperature selector knob controls the blower motor damper door position, allowing more or less heated/cooled air to be drawn into the sleeper. The selected blower speed and temperature selector knob position determine how much cooled or heated air is brought into the sleeper from the cab Blendaire system. The winter/summer switch electrically sets the temperature selector knob for either air conditioning (summer position) or heater (winter position).
